com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features

Class FeatureMemsSensorFusion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Feature
      • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features.FeatureAutoConfigurable
        • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features.FeatureMemsSensorFusion
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FeatureMemsSensorFusionCompact, FeatureRandomMemsSensorFusion

    public class FeatureMemsSensorFusion
extends FeatureAutoConfigurable
    This feature will contains the quaternion compute in the device using the sensor fusion algorithm (gyroscope + accelerometer + magnetometer).

    The data will be transfer using float data for each component.

    the quaternion components are normalized to 1

    Qi = x component, Qj = y component Qk = z component Qs = scalar component

    The AutoConfigure process will acquire the magnetometer data for calibrate the magnetometer sensors

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    STMicroelectronics - Central Labs.

      • getQs

        protected static float getQs(float qi,
                             float qj,
                             float qk)
        compute the q3 component knowing that quaternion is normalized, the sum of square is 1
        Parameters:
        qi - quaternion x component
        qj - quaternion y component
        qk - quaternion z component
        Returns:
        qs = sqrt(1- (qi^2+qj^2+qk^2))

      • extractData

        protected Feature.ExtractResult extractData(long timestamp,
                                            byte[] data,
                                            int dataOffset)
        extract the quaternion data from the raw node data, the q3 component is optional if the quaternion is normalized.

        this feature will read 16 if the quaternion is not normalized or it the w component is transmitted, 12 if the quaternion is normalized and the w component is not transmitted (will be computed by the feature)

        Specified by:
        extractData in class Feature
        Parameters:
        data - array where read the Field data
        dataOffset - offset where start to read the data
        timestamp - data timestamp
        Returns:
        number of read byte (16 or 12) and data extracted (the quaternion information)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the data array has not enough data

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: Feature
        print the last data received by this feature
